choices.text: A merge that happens very quickly
A merge where Git simply moves the branch pointer forward because there's no divergent history
A merge that skips conflict resolution
A merge between two remote repositories

question: Which command merges the "feature" branch into your current branch?
When does a fast-forward merge occur?

choices.text: When both branches have new commits
When the current branch has no new commits since the branching point

question: A fast-forward merge creates a new merge commit.
What is the purpose of `git merge --no-ff`?

choices.text: To prevent any merge from happening
To force a merge commit even when fast-forward is possible
